 <entry>
  <id>yt:video:p0wDUK0Z5Nw</id>
  <yt:videoId>p0wDUK0Z5Nw</yt:videoId>
  <yt:channelId>UCskGTioqrMBcw8pd14_334A</yt:channelId>
  <title>Interactive Progressively-enhanced Web Components with WebC</title>
  <link rel="alternate" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p0wDUK0Z5Nw"/>
  <author>
   <name>Eleventy</name>
   <uri>https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCskGTioqrMBcw8pd14_334A</uri>
  </author>
  <published>2022-09-29T21:27:11+00:00</published>
  <updated>2022-10-05T21:06:41+00:00</updated>
  <media:group>
   <media:title>Interactive Progressively-enhanced Web Components with WebC</media:title>
   <media:content url="https://www.youtube.com/v/p0wDUK0Z5Nw?version=3" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="640" height="390"/>
   <media:thumbnail url="https://i1.ytimg.com/vi/p0wDUK0Z5Nw/hqdefault.jpg" width="480" height="360"/>
   <media:description>In the WebC Crash Course video we covered the use of HTML components (with a little bit of CSS) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X-Bpjrkz-V8

In this video, we will go over how to create a WebC Web Component with clientside interactivity!

Read more on the Eleventy WebC plugin docs https://github.com/11ty/eleventy-plugin-webc
Read more about WebC syntax https://github.com/11ty/webc

Unsplash thumbnail by Robin Glauser https://unsplash.com/photos/zP7X_B86xOg</media:description>
   <media:community>
    <media:starRating count="110" average="5.00" min="1" max="5"/>
    <media:statistics views="2548"/>
   </media:community>
  </media:group>
 </entry>
 <entry>
  <id>yt:video:X-Bpjrkz-V8</id>
  <yt:videoId>X-Bpjrkz-V8</yt:videoId>
  <yt:channelId>UCskGTioqrMBcw8pd14_334A</yt:channelId>
  <title>Crash Course in Eleventy’s new WebC Plugin</title>
  <link rel="alternate" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X-Bpjrkz-V8"/>
  <author>
   <name>Eleventy</name>
   <uri>https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCskGTioqrMBcw8pd14_334A</uri>
  </author>
  <published>2022-09-27T19:01:37+00:00</published>
  <updated>2022-10-05T20:59:00+00:00</updated>
  <media:group>
   <media:title>Crash Course in Eleventy’s new WebC Plugin</media:title>
   <media:content url="https://www.youtube.com/v/X-Bpjrkz-V8?version=3" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="640" height="390"/>
   <media:thumbnail url="https://i1.ytimg.com/vi/X-Bpjrkz-V8/hqdefault.jpg" width="480" height="360"/>
   <media:description>Read more on the Eleventy WebC plugin docs https://github.com/11ty/eleventy-plugin-webc
Read more about WebC https://github.com/11ty/webc

WebC brings the following features to Eleventy:

🛠 First-class Incremental Builds
🕊 Per-page CSS/JS bundles
💻 Server-rendered Web Components
🍳 Using components without needing to `import` anything
🏝 Works great with is-land Hydration https://www.11ty.dev/docs/plugins/partial-hydration/
📐 Use with existing Eleventy template syntax (Nunjucks, Liquid, etc.)</media:description>
   <media:community>
    <media:starRating count="127" average="5.00" min="1" max="5"/>
    <media:statistics views="3002"/>
   </media:community>
  </media:group>
 </entry>

Eleventy Core Resources
* New syntax highlighter plugin version https://twitter.com/eleven_ty/status/1541876367528189953
* New vite plugin release https://twitter.com/eleven_ty/status/1547706932911214595
* Case sensitivity of tags https://github.com/11ty/eleventy/issues/2462

* Leaderboards №20 https://twitter.com/eleven_ty/status/1546887970363416576
* Community: Meta name generator blog post https://darn.es/you-should-add-a-generator-tag-to-your-eleventy-site/
* Full control over HTML, Eleventy Youtube video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b4frtsT4Cgo
* Wappalyzer and Eleventy https://twitter.com/murtuza_surti/status/1546502069904965632
* TOML front matter on windows https://github.com/11ty/eleventy/issues/586
* Canary 13: https://twitter.com/eleven_ty/status/1547969969341624323
* i18n Docs https://www.11ty.dev/docs/i18n/
* i18n Plugin https://www.11ty.dev/docs/plugins/i18n/

* Community: i18n URLs https://www.hoeser.dev/blog/2022-07-08-i18n-urls/
* Community: eleventy-plugin-i18n-helpers https://www.npmjs.com/package/eleventy-plugin-i18n-helpers
* `date: git Created` https://www.11ty.dev/docs/dates/#setting-a-content-date-in-front-matter
* Markdown Benchmarks https://www.zachleat.com/web/build-benchmark/
